programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs get fired up as they compete for charities near and dear to their hearts.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: As Rick and Marty continue to explore the abandoned shaft known as '10-X', they uncover evidence that may jeopardise their whole operation..

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy hopes to settle a score with a gator he has pursued for years, while another hunter makes a life-threatening choice to go deep into the swamp.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Gale-force winds shut down the Trans Canada Highway. Al and Gord try to recover a massive mining truck.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered an alternating-current motor invented by 19th-century pioneer Nikola Tesla, and a pair of trainers used in Back to the Future.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are awestruck by one of the rarest items ever to come through their doors - an artwork believed to be by Renaissance master Raphael.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: First-hand accounts from seasoned, decorated police officers who have had unbelievable but substantiated UFO encounters.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team uses high-tech sidescan sonar and deep sea magnetometers to search for evidence after learning of an encounter with an underwater phenomenon.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Two blade smiths pay homage to Hollywood, re-create one of the most famous swords in cinematic history.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: In the Wildfire Round, the chefs try not to crack under pressure. Then it is Fight or Flight in the Crossfire Round.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The signature round allows the chefs to serve up big flavours, big personality and some big mistakes.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les misses Ashley's presence in the shop, while a man employs menacing tactics to persuade the dealers to buy a couple of outdated computer monitors.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The retailers scrutinise a signature apparently made by deposed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein, and Les loses his cool with a customer over a broken necklace. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les attends a business meeting, and as soon as he has gone Ashley tries to undermine Seth. A vicious standoff results after the vendors fail to agree a price of some jewellery. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man tries to sell a series of poorly stuffed animals, leading to to an unusual threat being made against Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth continue continue their tense stand-off, but a demanding customer forces them to band together. A signed and authenticated Elvis record stimulates interest, but Les and Rich are wary of paying too much for it.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimi Hendrix's former photographer visits the shop with a selection of unpublished pictures, and the team values two dune buggies and a 1930s denim jacket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a device for predicting the outcome of horse races, and is shocked when a customer brings in a secret service ID and some counterfeit money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a torch from the 1984 Olympics, the world's smallest pistol and a 1937 car that may once have belonged to gangster Bugsy Siegel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick risks buying a painting supposedly by Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, but then has to ascertain if it is genuine. He also judges the value of a motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered an alternating-current motor invented by 19th-century pioneer Nikola Tesla, and a pair of trainers used in Back to the Future.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are awestruck by one of the rarest items ever to come through their doors - an artwork believed to be by Renaissance master Raphael.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Steve grapples with a vintage arm-wrestling arcade machine from the 1980s, while Dale attempts to restore a 104-year-old motorcycle.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor unearth artefacts from former military sites across the UK, starting with a German bomber found in Liverpool.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.sub-title: Douglas Bader and the Duxford Fliers
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor hunt for souvenirs left by flying ace Douglas Bader and the legendary Duxford Fliers.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating 'The Nine' - an alleged federation of extraterrestrial beings who some believe monitor and influence mankind.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating claims that China, with its history of technological advancement and isolationism, could have been the home of alien beings.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: New information is revealed, and questions are answered about the mystery of the RMS Republic, her gold cargo, and Martin Bayerle's obsessive quest to recover the bounty.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with comedian Sara Pascoe and former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner introduces a look back at some of the best bits from the series, plus a few hitherto unseen clips. Topics nominated for consignment to oblivion include dabbing, people who love the outdoors and The Archers.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Phil Wang, Brennan Reece, Rachel Parris
programme.desc: Phil Wang comperes the comedy show at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience before introducing routines by star of The Mash Report Rachel Parris and actor, voiceover artist and stand-up Brennan Reece.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A hapless former aristocrat stumbles upon an old house with a strange inhabitant. Miriam Margolyes narrates.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: More man-tastic DIY projects as brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in challenging and often quirky home improvement builds.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: More man-tastic DIY projects as brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in challenging and often quirky home improvement builds.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc and Chris Harris take a road trip across Sri Lanka in a pair of tiny tuk-tuks. Back at the track, Chris also tests out the latest super-saloons from BMW and Mercedes, while Professor Green sets a lap as this week's Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef takes a gastronomic road trip to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a melting pot of East and West. His journey begins in the city of Venice, and on the idyllic Greek island of Symi he cooks some of his favourite Venetian dishes including seafood risotto, tiramisu and gnocchi with spider crab.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys try to negotiate with a collector who demands a high price for every item up for sale, and check out a collection of Western memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a 135-year-old opera house full of memorabilia, and try to negotiate with a fellow picker charging a high price for his merchandise.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori win a surfboard, while Jesse and Papa Bear team up to bid on a safe protected by barbed wire.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori goes behind Brandon's back as she teams up with Jesse, while Papa Bear thinks there might be a shotgun hidden in one lot.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori and Brandon win one of two aviation storage units that have come up for sale, while biker Dan bags the other.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori find a hot-air balloon in their newly acquired trailer.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers face a harrowing situation as a family from Venezuela pleads with them to enter America. In Progreso, a suspected drug dealer is caught smuggling pills in his underpants.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three hosts are each given a budget of £5,000 to find a car that can hold its own on a racetrack and handle everyday tasks, before testing their purchases in Germany. James May puts two Porsches through their paces on the Top Gear test circuit, and former Downing Street communications director Alastair Campbell tries out the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters search for the world's best four-seat supercar, pitting the Aston Martin Rapide against the Porsche Panamera Turbo and Maserati Quattroporte in a series of unusual challenges in the south of England. Harry Potter star Rupert Grint and ex-Formula One driver Rubens Barrichello each do a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car and Richard Hammond puts the Chevrolet Camaro SS and Mercedes E63 AMG through their paces on the test track.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word 'literally' and the Grim Reaper.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Mrs Brown star Brendan O'Carroll, comedian Bob Mortimer and Countdown numbers expert Rachel Riley tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include urinal etiquette, food with bacon wrapped round it and the Essex girl stereotype.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV doctor Christian Jessen, actor and presenter Warwick Davis and writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include doctors, James Bond and people who send e-mails.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy is always looking for ways of improving her position in the world and sees another chance by befriending posh new neighbours Toby and Anna. But she hasn't reckoned on Lee dragging her right back down to earth. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the sitcom, with guest appearances from Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Daisy wins a place on TV quiz show Pointless and chooses Lucy as her partner - but changes her mind when Lee convinces the women of his intellectual prowess. The only problem is, he wasn't entirely honest with his friends, and now he has to appear on the programme knowing he's really a bit thick. Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman guest star in the sitcom, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee's dad Frank moves in after an argument with his latest fancy woman, but it soon becomes clear he's drinking too much, so the flatmates stage an intervention. If he agrees to seek help, he can stay - if he keeps boozing, they'll kick him out. Bobby Ball guest stars, with Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Compilation looking back at highlights of past episodes of the comedy quiz hosted by Dara O Briain, with regular panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison. From 2012.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu is back on home turf - cooking for comedian Phil Wang, who is performing his Philly Philly Wang Wang show in London's West End..

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: A September 2012 edition of the topical comedy quiz show, as guests Greg Davies, Andi Osho and Stewart Francis join host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison to offer their take on the week's news stories.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern and comedian Jo Caulfield joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The stories of famous hoaxes, featuring personal accounts of those who perpetrated and exposed them, beginning with the infamous alien autopsy footage.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The first of three programmes about the wildlife, landscape and culture in different areas of the country explores the Sierra Madre mountains, and reveals how this rugged landscape has shaped the nation. This chain of peaks includes several volcanoes and is home to a wide variety of animals, including black bears, monarch butterflies, orchid bees and quetzals. The programme also visits the ruins of an ancient Aztec shrine and the blue agave plant which grows in the mountains is used in making tequila.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. The region also holds a secret that is the key to how Mexico's people and animals are able to survive during the country's dry season.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the north, beginning with a tropical coral reef which has medicinal properties for dolphins, and is used as a tool by tusk fish. In Japan, a shipwreck is home to the Asian sheepshead wrasse, which can change gender, while in the polar north, walruses struggle to find ice floes for their pups to rest on as climate change takes its toll on the environment.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores St Pancras station in London and its sister hotel - built to show off the might of the Midlands, and learns about Castle Howard station in North Yorkshire.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: Divers search a newly discovered wreck as they investigate the story of the SS Justicia, sunk in the First World War by U-Boats off the coast of Ireland.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. Matters are complicated further when a client she was planning a new life with is found dead in her flat and tests reveal the father of her baby is Caucasian, putting her husband back in the frame, despite his alibi.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to rescue a familiar face, and a collapsing building traps an elderly woman. Starring Andrew Kazamia and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy attends a district nurses' conference in Scarborough, where she surprises everyone - including herself - with her instinctive knack for public speaking. Ruth, who's also along for the trip, spends the night at a former boyfriend's flat - but returns to Skelthwaite with a clear conscience. Drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Walter soon feels the heat when he manages to set his flat on fire, Simon clashes with Ruth over her commitment to the job and Peggy finally reaches an understanding with her son Stephen.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Having finally recovered from the death of his beloved Teresa, Sharpe marries Jane Gibbons. Before the honeymoon is over, he is forced to rush off and capture a fort behind French lines - and while he is away a fever outbreak threatens to cut short his new marriage. Sean Bean stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Pru from the Embassy visits Barry in jail and reassures the gang they are doing everything they can to free him - but the Cubans have discovered his Russian connections and convinced themselves he is a spy. Neville feels the pressure as he is forced to home in on his target, and Oz faces a major setback in his relationship with Ofelia. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A terrified Neville is kidnapped, driven through the back streets of Havana and deposited at an empty house - where he is greeted by Pru from the Embassy, who asks him to trap rogue operative Tarquin. Meanwhile, there is still no sign of Barry being released from jail, and his deteriorating condition prompts Oz to make a heartbreaking decision. Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star as chalk-and-cheese detectives determined to find the killer of a once-promising rugby player's wife. Clues point to the husband - but the duo suspect it could be part of a conspiracy. Adapted by Alan Plater from Reginald Hill's award-winning crime novels, with Ralph Brown and Susannah Corbett.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A couple stumble upon the body of an elderly man in the old hospital wing of an abandoned mental health facility, strapped to a gurney with electrodes connected to his temples.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial arsonist targets sites related to the 1983 general election. After risking his life in a burning building following a quiet word from Keats, Ray gets personally involved in the high-profile investigation - which forces him to face his traumatic past as it becomes clear the tragic events of the Falklands War are driving the firestarter to murder. Fantasy drama, with Dean Andrews and Joe Absolom (Doc Martin).

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene jeopardises a covert operation into a drug cartel when he learns several dealers have been murdered recently and the crimes are linked to an old adversary. Chris falls for the attractive undercover officer, but his feelings prompt a violent outburst that threatens his future in the police, and Alex gathers more clues about why she remains in the 1980s. With guest star Zoe Telford (Criminal Justice).

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: After The Pandemic: Our New World

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is handing out food to the neighbourhood animals when he stumbles on a gigantic hamster that Fizz has released from some parallel dimension..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo can't find the book that Linda lent him and he's ready to turn the house upside down to find it. The problem is that he's actually in Fizz's loft..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, thinking he's at the laundromat, wanders into a candy factory, where Fizz and Weasel are creating a bubblegum that makes Fizz-shaped bubbles..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Stephan upgrades the house's security system, and Mike may be able to take a break from playing guard dog. Maybe. Possibly.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons stumble upon an old whistle and discover that it has strange powers over Mike. Can Mike combat their new power over him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Eating too many sweets gives Bean a terrible toothache, and when all other attempts at curing it are exhausted, he reluctantly visits the dreaded dentist.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The halfwit becomes a hero after rescuing a kitten from a tree, and looks forward to having his picture in the local paper. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Phil and Grandpa Max tune-up the Omni-Copter.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes: Avengers Reassembled
programme.desc: A party at Avengers Tower is cut short when Ultron takes control of Iron Man's armour.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by guests Roman Kemp and Vick Hope, and chefs Marcus Wareing, Jose Pizarro and Bettina Campolucci Bordi. Featuring recipes for chicken pithivier and cheesecake, and a masterclass in the best way to prepare steak.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner bring their favourite flavours of Greece to the UK, preparing rack of lamb, prawn saganaki pies, a cheat's moussaka and a deceptively easy baklava.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The TV chef begins the Texan leg of his American adventure by visiting a place with more than a hint of Mexican spice, as San Antonio was once a part of Mexico. Amidst the wonders of the city, James tries fresh churros and a traditional barbecoa - Mexican barbecue.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present behind-closed-doors coverage, including the 3.35 Qipco 2,000 Guineas Stakes from Newmarket, plus races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.00, and races at 2.05, 2.40 and 3.15 from Newcastle. With analysis from Jason Weaver and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: A chance to catch the original US version of the show in which mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Butterfly, Egg, Thingamajig and Skeleton take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian revives another classic game show with an episode of The Price Is Right. Eight members of the studio audience will be invited to 'Come on Down' and spin the famous wheel, guess the value of assorted items, and compete in the Epic Showcase for the chance to win a mountain of prizes.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.

credits.actor: Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness recreate James Cameron's 1991 sci-fi blockbuster Terminator 2: Judgment Day. The comic duo are joined by an all-star cast including Jaime Winstone, Rick Astley and Hank Osasuna to tell the story of a cyborg that is sent back in time to protect the future saviour of the human race from a shape-changing assassin.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: Michael embarks on some shopping trips to the US, tries to get his airplane business of the ground and races to deliver three school buses to Savannah port on time.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: HMS Bulwark returns from a vital humanitarian mission rescuing migrants in the Mediterranean, and a Devonport sailor takes his relaxation time to excessive new levels.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJS to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China take the finished Jaguar XJS for a test drive and invite potential buyers to view it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an XK8 Jaguar in poor condition, giving mechanic Edd China a tough challenge to fix it up within a tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for £1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than £5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The arrival of a 747 Jumbo Jet has the team members itching to dismantle this giant of the sky. However, they immediately struggle fitting it into the parking bay.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After an injury to one of their members, the Young Guns face a tough decision on how to continue mining. Meanwhile, the Cheals break through to a long-lost underground mine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds one of only 1,000 Mini Cooper S MC40s ever made, the 40th anniversary homage to the Monte Carlo rally-winning British icon.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part two of three. Henry Cole heads out from Apollo Bay to ride up towards Adelaide on one of the greatest roads in the world, the Great Ocean Road.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After an injury to one of their members, the Young Guns face a tough decision on how to continue mining. Meanwhile, the Cheals break through to a long-lost underground mine.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: Having been kicked off their gold mine, Scott and George need to buy a new claim to keep their dreams alive. However, raising the necessary cash involves a dangerous deal.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police use trace evidence and paint analysis to track down a killer preying on male prostitutes. Saliva and ink found at the scene of a murder help link a husband to his estranged wife's death.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2016 car salesman Hufracio Arteaga was found stabbed to death in his Michigan City office. Surveillance cameras at a nearby building offered hope in catching his killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The fatal shooting of the sheriff of Cleveland, Oklahoma. Law enforcement determined to find justice for their fellow officer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a girl who was abducted while camping with her family, examining the phone call on the anniversary of her disappearance that led to the culprit's conviction.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A police homicide inquiry uncovers seven emaciated dogs in the backyard of a house. Plus, investigators have to catch scores of starving chickens.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Harriet the Bearded Dragon has a worrying lump on the side of her leg that requires an urgent operation, and a sick 10-week-old puppy is put in danger by her protective owner.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: A Tale of Two Bridesmaids' Dresses
programme.desc: Bride Julie is fighting with her party because she wants two different dresses - one for bridesmaids and one for the honorary bridesmaids.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Margaret talks about missing her deceased mother as she shops for a wedding dress, while Emily feels lucky to have her mum's support.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Caitlyn has no intention of sharing the spotlight while shopping for a dress, while Mojdeh is convinced her consultant will not be able to help.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Danni Dusek helps her friend's cat that keeps fighting with its neighbour. Meanwhile, Dr Peter Ricci struggles to get close to Lottie the ferocious and frightened Chihuahua.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex Hynes tries to treat a Labrador-staffy cross that has been attacked by another dog. Plus, carers attend to an American bulldog which has eaten a whole packet of macadamia nuts.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 600lbs, Angie is trying to get to Houston to see Dr Now and get life-saving weight-loss surgery. However, a family conflict proves to be an obstacle.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Forty four-year-old Erica binges on food when faced with adversity, and previous weight-loss surgery was unsuccessful. Can she get the support she needs to change her habits?.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. The car she was travelling in has never been recovered, though it was possibly spotted two weeks later in Camden, New Jersey.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Jordan is due to marry her childhood sweetheart and brings her mum, sister, and opinionated auntie along to find her perfect winter wonderland dress. British version of the reality show about bridal shops, set in an Essex boutique.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride brings her father with her when she chooses a wedding dress, while another customer realises that the time has finally come to tell her dad that she has a tattoo.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Caitie and her wedding planner father clash over a gown, while Danielle lost her mother to cancer, so her dad steps in to help her make the big decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides are torn between a sexy look or a traditional one - and a disapproving father knows which he would prefer to see his daughter wearing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is more concerned with pleasing her mother than herself, while another customer has no idea what style of dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot choose between two dresses she thinks are perfect - while another customer has tried on 50 gowns and thinks none of them are right.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former model Meghan comes all the way from St Louis to find the perfect dress for her wedding to a baseball player.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Zabrina looks for an extravagant ball gown for her wedding, while Cheryl is nervous about seeing her custom dress for the first time.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo receives a visit from her daughter Victoria, who has some news, and meets a boy hoping to speak to his deceased sister.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo tries to shed a few pounds and performs a reading for a woman who wants to find out more about her son's death.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo encounters a spirit she has never felt before, and sets Larry to task decorating the bathroom.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo brings comfort to Long Islanders affected by Hurricane Sandy, delivering messages from their deceased loved ones.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman whose OCD has driven her to accumulate hundreds of items, and a man whose children insist he is a hoarder.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: A case involving a 33-year-old spent much of her time flirting with men online. When she failed to turn up for work, her friends worried about her fate.

programme.title: Surviving Evil
programme.desc: The case of Heather Imming, who was determined to build a new life for herself and her daughter folliowing the end of her abusive marriage. However, the ex-husband was waiting in the shadows for an opportunity to strike a lethal blow.

programme.title: Who Killed Jeffrey Epstein: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Exclusive interviews and an in-depth investigation reveal new clues about Jeffrey Epstein's seedy underworld, privileged life and controversial death.
